results.title: The Mirror of man
results.brief_description: A statement on behalf of contemporary art. Presents the movement from the first break with classical form to our art expression of today. Paintings used in the film were selected from the 1958 Retrospective Exhibition at the Carnegie Institute at Pittsburgh, which presented a survey of paintings shown at the International Exhibitions of the Institute since 1894. Commentator: Vincent Price

results.title: The Mirror [Widescreen] [NTSC]
results.brief_description: After her mother fails to pick her up after school, a young Iranian girl with a broken arm (Mina Mohammed-Khani) sets off to find her own way home. As she traverses the bustling streets of Tehran, clogged with the press of people, traffic, and noise, she grows increasingly uncertain of her direction and the correct route. The everyday sounds, movements and interactions of city life are conveyed through her experiences as she encounters strangers both helpful and indifferent, rides on buses, and is confronted with rules regarding male and female behaviour. Midway through, the film takes a startling turn that breaks the audience’s engagement with the narrative and throws the constructed nature of this naturalistic documentation of city life into relief. The actor playing the young girl suddenly abandons her character declaring that she has had enough of acting and wants to go home. As she leaves the set the crew decide to keep filming as she undergoes a process almost identical to that of her character in her attempts to find her way home on her own. Rather than functioning as a distancing device, this shift offers an alternate version of a reality mediated by cinema. The focus on the filmmaking process itself and the use of non-actors and children in lead roles are all characteristic hallmarks of recent Iranian cinema. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops. Part 5
results.creator_credit: Millenium Pictures, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky
results.brief_description: Mr. Dump is not the Grand Baby after all. The Grand Baby passes away and the Moonlings are left to their own devices. Before he disappears, the Grand Baby gives Gamma Jane the secret code which reveals which of the Mellops is to replace him. Michael and Harmony expose Mr. Dump’s illegal activities, and Mr. Dump’s latest money scheme fails. Michael works out the code and reveals which Mellop family member is to return to the Moon as the new Grand Baby. In an energy transference, the new Grand Baby goes to the Moon and Harmony returns home. Gamma Jane and Alpha Ralph leave and Dad goes berserk over the lunar phonebill.

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops. Part 4
results.creator_credit: Millenium Pictures, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky
results.brief_description: Mr Dump’s waste dump business involves dealings with some very shady characters and strange waste materials. Harmony and Michael are having doubts about the business. The Mellops are trying to find Aunt Jocelyn’s magic toothpaste with the linguistic powers. Sam decides that as the Grand Baby is getting weaker, she will leave her family and return to the Moon as she is convinced that she is the Grand Baby. However the Grand Baby test fails on the Mellops and it appears that Mr. Dump may be the likely candidate.

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Millenium Pictures, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky
results.brief_description: Ralph uses the time-travel vacuum cleaner and returns to the Age of Dinosaurs. The Moon flowers are multiplying and making money for the nursery, but Bill Mellops still does not realise that Jane and Ralph are from the Moon. Harmony and Michael travel to the Moon in the combi, and on their return Mr. Dump steals the van with the intention of using the Moon as a waste dump.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Millenium Pictures, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Millenium Pictures, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky
results.brief_description: Gamma Jane and Alpha Ralph are continuing to search for a replacement for the Grand Baby. Sam and Jason Mellops match wits with their brother Michael and Harmony Dump, to retrieve the magic articles which endow the “user” with special powers including the ability to fly, time-travel, be speedy and master languages. Mr. Dump is eager to obtain these powers for himself so he can make a million dollars.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Millenium Pictures, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Millenium Pictures, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky
results.brief_description: The Miraculous Mellops is a fantasy tale about interplanetary co-operation, faith, trust, young love and greed. When the Mellops children, Samantha, Michael and Jason meet Moon Emissaries, Gamma Jane and Alpha Ralph, they discover that nothing will be the same again. The Moon’s 2000 year old leader, ‘The Grand Baby’ is dying and the new ruler is believed to be a member of the Mellop family. The question is - which one? Meanwhile, the plant nursery run by father Bill Mellop and Aunt Jocelyn is experiencing problems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Millenium Pictures, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops 2. Part 5
results.creator_credit: Millenium Pictures, Film Australia, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky
results.brief_description: Dump wants to use the compressed sun to make money while the Mellops try and think of a way to dissaude the Grubs from visiting Earth. Dump is using the WOOPS and the compressed sun to tan everyone in London. The countdown begins for the Grubs visit. Sam and Michael WOOP themselves aboard the spaceship only to be toffeed and the Grubs ignore her’s and Michael’s speeches. Eventually some order is restored. The Grubs prepare to join their cocoons and grow up, while on earth, the re-opening of the plant nursery means the party can begin.

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops 2. Part 4
results.creator_credit: Millenium Pictures, Film Australia, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky
results.brief_description: The Mellops encounter black holes, compressed suns and the anti-matter paperbag. An encounter with an anti-universe has everyone feeling not quite themselves. The Grubs continue on their gluttonous path, eating a now toffeeized Opera House model and making preparations to come to earth for a party at the plant nursery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Millenium Pictures, Film Australia, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops 2. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Millenium Pictures, Film Australia, Posie Graeme-Evans and Karl Zwicky
results.brief_description: Using the Intergalatic phone book, the Mellops use the WOOP to go to Planet Peaceful where the Grubs have caused havoc. Sam and Mike get WOOPed aboard the Grub Spaceship where they try to unsuccessfully gain access to the WOOP manual. The grubs try to eat Dump but he tastes so awful that they let him go. The return to Earth is not a pleasant experience and Dump makes it back in his underpants.
